title.narrative: Tanzania - Institutional Support Project for Good Governance - Phase Three (ISPGG III)
Tanzanie - Projet d’appui institutionnel à la bonne gouvernance - Phase III (ISPGG III)

description.narrative: Les bénéficiaires directs du projet sont : pour la Chine continentale, le Ministère des finances et de la planification, l'Unité PPP, l'Autorité de réglementation des marchés publics (PPRA), le Bureau de l'auditeur général interne (IAGO), le Contrôleur et auditeur général (CAG), le Bureau de prévention et de lutte contre la corruption (PCCB) et le Secrétariat à la déontologie. Pour Zanzibar, les bénéficiaires sont les institutions suivantes : MdF, Zanzibar Investment Promotion Agency (ZIFA), Department of Stock Verification, the Accountant General's Office, the Zanzibar Office of the Controller and Auditor General, the PPP Unit and the Ministry of Trade. Les bénéficiaires indirects sont l'ensemble de la population tanzanienne, qui bénéficiera d'un meilleur rapport qualité-prix dans le domaine des marchés publics, d'une amélioration de la prestation des services grâce à la transparence et à la responsabilisation et de meilleures perspectives économiques, notamment la création d'emplois, grâce à la stimulation des investissements du secteur privé grâce à un meilleur climat commercial.

The direct project beneficiaries are: for the Mainland, the Ministry of Finance and Planning, PPP Unit, the Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (PPRA), Internal Auditor General’s Office (IAGO), the Controller and Auditor General (CAG), the Prevention and Combatting of Corruption Bureau (PCCB) and the Ethics Secretariat. For Zanzibar, the beneficiaries are the following institutions: MoF, Zanzibar Investment Promotion Agency (ZIFA), Department of Stock Verification, the Accountant General’s Office, the Zanzibar Office of the Controller and Auditor General, the PPP Unit and the Ministry of Trade. The indirect beneficiaries are the general population of Tanzania, who will benefit from improved value for money in public procurement, improved service delivery arising from transparency and accountability and enhanced economic opportunities, including employment creation, arising from stimulation of private sector investments as a result of improved business climate.

Le projet s'appuie sur le renforcement des capacités et les réformes de la GFP soutenus par la Banque en Tanzanie et complète les interventions des PDD. L'opération proposée contribuera à remédier aux faiblesses de la GFP et de l'environnement commercial, et à intensifier et soutenir les efforts de renforcement des capacités en Tanzanie. Il appuiera les efforts visant à renforcer les capacités, la responsabilisation et l'intégrité dans la gestion des ressources publiques par les principales institutions de contrôle et institutions économiques et financières. Elle contribuera également à lutter contre la corruption, à rationaliser les processus d'enregistrement des entreprises et d'octroi de licences et à rendre opérationnel le cadre des PPP. Le projet comporte deux volets : (i) Améliorer l'efficacité de la gestion des finances publiques et (ii) Créer un environnement propice aux investissements privés.

The project builds upon Bank-supported capacity building and PFM reforms in Tanzania, and complements DPs’ interventions. The proposed operation will contribute to addressing weaknesses in PFM and the business environment, and intensifying and sustaining capacity building efforts in Tanzania. It will support efforts geared towards enhancing capacity, accountability and integrity in the management of public resources by key oversight and economic/finance institutions. It will also help the fight againts corruption; the streamlining of business registration and licensing processes and operationalising the PPP framework. The project has two components: (i) Enhancing the Effectiveness of Public Financial Management and (ii) Creating an Enabling Environment for Private Investments.

L'objectif de développement du projet est d'aider le gouvernement tanzanien à promouvoir une croissance inclusive et la stabilité macroéconomique en améliorant la gouvernance économique et financière par une gestion plus efficace des finances publiques et un meilleur environnement commercial.

The project’s development objective is to support Government Of Tanzania in promoting inclusive growth and macroeconomic stability by enhancing economic and financial governance through more effective public financial management and improved business environment.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

title.narrative: Number of procuring entities strengthened through roll out of eprocurement applications
People trained / recruited - of which women
Starting a business score (WB Doing Business)
Reinforce the Ethics Secretariat’s capacity to conduct asset verification

actual.value: A Public Assets and Liability Verification Framework has been developed and is undergoing testing

title.narrative: Internal audit of government budget process and payroll conducted
Accountability, control and scrutiny of public finances (as measured by PEFA) - PI-26
Accountability, control and scrutiny of public finances (as measured by PEFA) - PI-21
Relevant business laws and regulations on procedures to start a business amended

actual.value: Government has approved the blue print

title.narrative: Guidelines for monitoring and auditing PPP projects developed and disseminated

actual.value: Guidelines has been completed and is currently in use

title.narrative: Legislation to enable online license processing developed
Study on cost overruns/variations during contract execution conducted
Study on the effectiveness of governance arrangements in selected key processes in PSOs conducted

actual.value: The PCCB anti-corruption strategic plan 2017/18 -2021/22 is operational

title.narrative: Public private Partnership (PPP) feasibility studies conducted

actual.value: The PPP guidelines have been prepared and has been used in the selection of eight PPP project

title.narrative: Draft Public private Partnership (PPP) Manual reviewed to synchronise with new PPP Law

target.value: Public private Partnership (PPP) Manual finalised an approved

actual.value: The PPP guidelines have been prepared and has been used in the selection of eight PPP project
The infrastructure has been installed and the system was launched

title.narrative: Online portal for licenses and procedures established

actual.value: The online company registration system (BRELA) is operational

title.narrative: Audit offices equipped with hardware and software: new offices in Dodoma

actual.value: The procurement for the LAN and LAN for the Prevention and Combatting of Corruption Bureau (PCCB) district offices has been finalized and the equipment is being supplied

title.narrative: Prevention and Combatting of Corruption Bureau (PCCB) district offices capacitated through installation of Local Area Network (LAN) for district offices

actual.value: The procurement for the WAN has been awarded and installation

title.narrative: Internal Auditor General (IAG) capacity strengthened through enhanced connectivity

actual.value: The procurement process is at an advanced stage
The suppliers manual has been updated and is accessible on the e-Procurement website
